newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: Owens Corning buys control of SAfrica's AFI.
newsitem.headline: Owens Corning buys control of SAfrica's AFI.

text.p: U.S. multi-national Owens Corning has sealed a deal for a 100 million rand majority shareholding in Acoustical Fibreglass Insulation (AFI), the South African firm said on Monday.
Ohio-based Owens Coring will take a 51 percent slice of privately-owned AFI and re-establish an interest in a firm that it originally sold to Federale Volksbeleggings in 1982.
AFI, which is Africa's largest insulation maker, will now be called Owens Corning South Africa (Pty) Ltd.
Owens Corning said South Africa offered excellent investment opportunities for overseas players.

"The stated intention of government to stimulate economic growth will be an important catalyst in attracting additional foreign investment," said Warren Knowlton, presdident of Owens Corning Building Materials Europe.
AFI makes fibreglass reinforcement for the plastics industry, mineral glasswool insulation and slagwool/rockwool insulation in plants in Gauteng and North West Province.
Owens Corning had 1995 sales of $3.6 billion and employs 18,000 people in more than 30 countries.

Earlier this month another U.S. group, drugs giant American Home Products, returned to South Africa when its Wyeth-Ayerst/Whitehall International unit bought six drugs it originally owned from South African Druggists.
AHP had left the South African market in 1989.
